author: felicity
msg: bug 1723: X-Perlmx-Spam is the PerlMX equiv of X-Spam-Status, so lets ignore it.

author: felicity
msg: rfc violations aren't necessarily great spam indicators.
all of the header_count_bad rules suck, except for the ctype one which seems
to do a pretty decent job, even though it's not an rfc violation.  to deal
with fps, I added code to treat multiple headers with the exact same content

author: felicity
msg: the blank comment rule didn't perform well, so it's gone.
the alphanum comment rule is ok, but it looks like some versions of Mozilla
add in a spurious empty comment which triggers the rule, so add a meta and
